text: Calanthe fargesii is a species of plant in the family Orchidaceae. It is endemic to China (Chongqing, Gansu, Guizhou, and Sichuan provinces).Kew World Checklist of Selected Plant FamiliesFlora of China v 25 p 299, 天府虾脊兰 tian fu xia ji lan, Calanthe fargesii Finet Its natural habitats are subtropical or tropical moist lowland forests and subtropical or tropical moist montane forests.China Plant Specialist Group 2004. Calanthe fargesii. 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Downloaded 20 August 2007. The Latin specific epithet fargesii refers to the French missionary and amateur botanist Père Paul Guillaume Farges (1844–1912).Allen J. Coombes Janet Mohun (senior editor) == References == Category:Endemic orchids of China Category:Vulnerable plants fargesii Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Calanthe fargesii
